attributes.action: Make All Wheelchair Accessible Taxis Zero Rated VAT to customers
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the maximum number of seats a Taxi can have is 8 + driver.
This rule is outdated and incompatible with DDA rules.
Taxis provide a vital public service the same as buses & community transport, they are zero rated taxis are not.
The government want more accessible taxis below is what taxi firms are up against 
Cost more to buy
Cost More to Run (fuel)
Cost more to Tax  
Cost More to Insure 

But Taxi firms are Prohibited by law from charging more,
attributes.background:
Make all wheelchair Taxis zero rated to users of it regardless of how many seats vehicle originally has before conversion.
Current rules say that vehicle must have 10 seats or more seats before conversion provided that 2 seats are removed or disabled solely for transporting wheelchair passengers.
